text:
At the moment, i’m starting a diploma of information and communication at l’Université de Rennes 2. Before that, I tried different ones : my first year after my graduation from high school, I went for a language license to learn languages (English and Spanish mostly) but I did not like it. So after, I tried to complete it with a law license, but doing both at the same time wasn’t quite simple. Plus, with the coronavirus and all the courses being distancial it was really a hard time to focus. The year after, I took a break from school, went working to search for an idea, an inspiration of what I wanted to do, what I wanted to study.
A sure thing after working in bars and restaurants for a while is that I was ready to go back to school, I was expecting that with enthusiasm. I just had to figure out what to study. And like that, the meet I needed arrived. It was a girl, a friend of mine, and as we we’re just speaking of our lives, she told me about the studies she did : information and communication. She had passed this diploma a few years ago and was leaving in Paris on a trip for the company she was working for.
The kind of life she was living, the things she wanted to do, the multiple opportunities of different jobs she had, all of these things made me realize that I wanted my life to be at least a bit like her’s.
She’s not THE source of inspiration on which I’m going to dedicate my life to make it look like her’s, but she really put me in this way. She showed me that I didn’t have to do only one job for my entire life and that there were a lot of job options, trips, etc…
So, I started this, a license that can be useful in so many works, and not just that, the communication is used everywhere. It’s just a plus in my personal life too. I still don’t know today what I'm gonna do as a job or even in my life but I’m hoping that I can one day be as free as she is.
